alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 06 at 2:12PM AKST until December 07 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. South winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Ice may pile up on the beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will continue into early Thursday. The worst conditions are expected this afternoon and evening when south winds dramatically increase. Visibility will drop to near zero at times this afternoon and evening. Conditions will improve early Thursday as winds decrease. Strong south winds this afternoon and evening could lead to elevated surf pushing ice onto the beach. People with valuables on beach should move them further inland.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
